dirl.agent
Class DIRLProgram<S extends dirl.state.DIRLAgentState,A extends dirl.action.DIRLAction>

java.lang.Object
  dirl.agent.DIRLProgram<S,A>
All Implemented Interfaces:
aima.core.agent.AgentProgram
public class DIRLProgram<S extends dirl.state.DIRLAgentState,A extends dirl.action.DIRLAction>
extends java.lang.Object
implements aima.core.agent.AgentProgram

A program that executes the Distributed Independent Reinforcement Learning algorithm.

Author:
James Giller 109466711

keyStates

private java.util.List<S extends dirl.state.DIRLAgentState> keyStates
Representative members of the state space used in learning. To keep storage overhead low, states can be grouped together by closeness in hamming distance.

Constructor Detail

DIRLProgram

public DIRLProgram(aima.core.probability.mdp.ActionsFunction<S,A> af,
                   dirl.action.PriorityOrder<A> ordering,
                   int maxNumStates,
                   double threshold,
                   dirl.agent.ExplorationProbabilityFunction epf,
                   double maxProbExplore,
                   double minProbExplore,
                   double learningRate,
                   double discount)
Set up a DIRLProgram.

Parameters:
af - A function that maps states to sets of applicable actions.
ordering - A priority ordering over actions to be executed.
maxNumStates - The maximum number of representative states to use for learning.
threshold - The upper bound on hamming distance for two states to be similar.
maxProbExplore - The maximum probability to perform exploration.
minProbExplore - The minimum probability to perform exploration.
learningRate - Controls the weight given to previously learned utilities.
discount - Controls the weight given to possible future rewards.
Method Detail

execute

public aima.core.agent.Action execute(aima.core.agent.Percept percept)
Specified by:
execute in interface aima.core.agent.AgentProgram

execute

public A execute(aima.core.learning.reinforcement.PerceptStateReward<S> percept)
                                         throws dirl.StateSpaceFullException
Execute a cycle of the DIRL algorithm.

The program will observe the current state of the agent, and choose an action to execute based on learned utilities.

Parameters:
percept - A percept indicating the current state and reward signal.
Returns:
an action to execute in the current state.
Throws:
dirl.StateSpaceFullException - if a novel state cannot be handled because the internal state space has reached its maximum size.

explore

protected A explore(S s)
Choose a task to execute independent of utility of execution while in s.

DIRL chooses a task uniformly at random that is applicable in s.

Parameters:
s - The state in which the action will be executed.
Returns:
An action to execute.

exploit

protected A exploit(S s)
Choose a task to execute based on the learned utilities while in s.

If actions are found with equal utilities, priority will be used to decide the action to execute.

Parameters:
s - The state in which the task will be executed.
Returns:
An action to execute.

policy

protected A policy(S s)
Decide on an action to perform in state s using exploration or exploitation.

Parameters:
s - The current state of the agent.
Returns:
An action to perform in state s.

updateUtility

protected void updateUtility(S s,
                             A a,
                             S sPrime,
                             java.lang.Double r)
Update the utility for executing a while in s arriving at sPrime.

Parameters:
s - State in which a was executed.
a - Action just executed.
sPrime - State arrived at after executing a.
r - The reward for executing a in s.

maxUtil

private double maxUtil(S s)
Parameters:
s - A state.
Returns:
The maximum expected utility of being in state s.

argMaxUtilA

private java.util.Set<A> argMaxUtilA(S s)
Parameters:
s - A state.
Returns:
The set of actions with the highest utilities in state s.

private java.util.Map<A,java.lang.Double> freshUtilitiesFor(java.util.Set<A> actions)

accommodateState

private void accommodateState(S strangeState)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Allow a novel state to be learned when maximum size of internal state space has been reached.

A successful execution of this method should accommodate the strangeState into the state space. This can include a state replacement policy, or adjusting the scheme of grouping similar states.

Take care to avoid any side effects of the execution of this method that invalidate the learning already done. For example by causing previously discovered states that were similar to lose similarity.

Parameters:
strangeState - The state that was discovered and found to be different from all states already explored, before the call to this method.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if strangeState cannot be accommodated under application constraints, at the discretion of the implementer.

getThresholdIncrement

private double getThresholdIncrement()
